intro: Senecio nervatus, commonly known as the narrow-leaf senecio, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are narrow and often have a hairy texture, while its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in clusters. Senecio nervatus is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and resilience.
